info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:12PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHEASTERN DEARBORN, NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 212 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Brookville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Fairfield, Forest Park, Springdale, Harrison, North College Hill, Cheviot, Mount Healthy, Brookville, Bright, Finneytown, Ross, Taylor Creek, Dry Ridge, Blue Jay, Dunlap, Pleasant Hills, Skyline Acres and Monfort Heights. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 159 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
